Stacey Vanek Smith, a senior reporter for Marketplace, tells us about a study that shows that any game, violent imagry or harmless, can lead to violent outbursts after the players get frustrated and “rage quit” the game.

description: Stacey Vanek Smith, a senior reporter for Marketplace, tells us about a study that shows that any game, violent imagry or harmless, can lead to violent outbursts after the players get frustrated and “rage quit” the game.
contentencoded: Stacey Vanek Smith, a senior reporter for Marketplace, tells us about a study that shows that any game, violent imagry or harmless, can lead to violent outbursts after the players get frustrated and “rage quit” the game.
teaser: Stacey Vanek Smith, a senior reporter for Marketplace, tells us about a study that shows that any game, violent imagry or harmless, can lead to violent outbursts after the players get frustrated and “rage quit” the game.
title: ‘Rage Quitting’ Video Games Leads to Violence
